intro: Reseda minoica, commonly known as Minoan Reseda, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in areas of Greece and other parts of southern Europe. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Reseda minoica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and historical significance in ancient cultures.
